meanings.definition: A small spherical mass or drop
meanings.sent1: The tiny globules of water sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The scientist observed the globules under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally added too many globules of salt to the soup.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like globules of liquid amber, reflecting the firelight.
meanings.sent5: The globules of paint on the canvas created a beautiful abstract pattern.

meanings.definition: A small round particle or droplet
meanings.sent1: The globules of mercury rolled off the table.
meanings.sent2: The globules of oil floated on the surface of the water.
meanings.sent3: The children blew bubbles with globules of soap.
meanings.sent4: The globules of dew on the grass glistened in the morning light.
meanings.sent5: The globules of sweat on his forehead indicated his hard work.
